info.title: International Trade Administration API
info.description: This is an inventory of APIs available at the International Trade Administration

get.description: U.S. businesses can use these reports to plan their market-entry the right way. The reports help them learn their productâ€™s potential in a given market and the best prospects for success.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Searches for a match within the event_name and description fields.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Returns office locations based on ISO alpha-2 country codes.

parameters.name: expiration_date
parameters.description: Returns entries based on their expiration date.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the maximum amount of hits to be returned.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset parameter defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch.

get.description: The Consolidated Screening List API consolidates eleven export screening lists of the Departments of Commerce, State and the Treasury into a single data feed as an aid to industry in conducting electronic screens of potential parties to regulated transactions.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Searches for a match within the event_name and description fields.

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: Searches only the lists specified by the Source Abbreviation.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Searches only parties whose country field matches the country code based on ISO alpha-2 country codes.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Searches against fields in the addresses array.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Searches against the name and alt_names fields.

parameters.name: fuzzy_name
parameters.description: Fuzzy name matching enables users to query a name and get usable results without knowing the exact spelling of an entry. It works by expanding queries to include results that are fuzzily similar to the given term, where similarity is defined by distance - the number of changes required to get from one term to another.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Searches based on the type of the entry (e.g, Individual, Entity, Vessel).

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Returns entries based on their start date.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Returns entries based on their end date.

parameters.name: issue_date
parameters.description: Returns entries based on the issue dates of the ids array.

parameters.name: expiration_date
parameters.description: Returns entries based on the expiration dates of the ids array.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the maximum amount of hits to be returned.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset parameter defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch.

get.description: Provides information on industry conferences, webinars, lectures and trade missions organized by the U.S. Dept. of Commerce.

get.description: The Trade Leads API provides contract opportunities for U.S. businesses selling their products and services overseas. These leads come from a variety of sources and we continue to expand the number of leads available.

get.description: The Tariff Rates API provides data about each country with whom the United States has a Free Trade Agreement (FTA). When the U.S. enters into an FTA with a foreign government, it negotiates lower tariff rates with that government for a wide variety of products. A tariff is a tax that a company must pay a foreign country when shipping a product to that country. Typically the FTA tariffs rates decline over several years.

get.description: The Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) API includes more than 300 commonly asked questions about exporting. The answers provided are from government experts that specialize in unique aspects of trade.

get.description: The ITA Offices & Centers API provides contact and address information for all of ITAâ€™s domestic and international export assistance centers. There are almost 200 ITA centers worldwide whose locations are managed by ITAâ€™s internal office management system.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Returns office locations based on city name.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Returns locations for export assistance centers located in a specific U.S. State or Dependent Area.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Returns office locations based on ISO alpha-2 country codes.

get.description: The Trade News & Articles API provides in-depth news and articles written by Trade Specialists working in the Federal government. The authors include staff from ITA as well as other Trade Promotion Coordinating Committee (TPCC) agencies.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Searches for a match within the event_name and description fields.

parameters.name: export_phases
parameters.description: Returns articles based on the export phase.

parameters.name: industries
parameters.description: Returns articles based on industry name.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Returns office locations based on ISO alpha-2 country codes.

parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the maximum amount of hits to be returned.

id.description: Unique identifier assigned to the report.

countries.description: Country category(ies) assigned to the report.

expiration_date.description: Date when the report is no longer valid.

industries.description: Industry categories assigned to the report.

report_type.description: The report type can either be CCG, Best Market Report, or Market Research Report.

end_date.description: The date on which the entity’s inclusion on the list will be lifted, wavied, or will have expired.

federal_register_notice.description: The official source of information about the parties on this list.

remarks.description: Additional remarks or notes regarding the company, entity, or person on the list.

standard_order.description: Whether or not (Y/N) the standard order applies to the Denied Party as defined by the Bureau of Industry and Security (BIS).

start_date.description: The effective date for the entity to be included on the list as defined by the Federal Register Notice.

source_information_url.description: Information from the Source agency about the list.

source.description: Denied Persons List (DPL) - Bureau of Industry and Security.

license_requirement.description: The license requirement as determined by the Export Administration Regulations.

license_policy.description: The policy set forth in the Export Administration Regulations regarding denial.

alt_names.description: Alias names used by the entity.

programs.description: Agency program related to the entity on the list.

entity_number.description: Unique id assigned by the originating list.

lead_source.description: Source of the trade lead, typically an organization.

country.description: The country associated with the lead.
